talk.author: did:plc:jfj6sqkawa2r72dhrx3rvjgr
talk.utter: If Musk weren't the CEO, most people here would be fawning over Tesla (minus the Cyber Truck). Tesla is still an important piece of the solution in a fossil fuel exodus. The answer is to boot Musk, not hate Tesla.

talk.author: did:plc:olhz4kpvyvlakhao4ewrtn3o
talk.utter: Mmm. Tesla has lost a lot of its luster. In 2019 I was searching for a new car and nearly bought a Tesla. The fit and finish quality was poor, the FDS an expensive joke, and the models have had little upgrade since then. /1

talk.author: did:plc:olhz4kpvyvlakhao4ewrtn3o
talk.utter:
Tesla was ground breaking, and pre-Ketamine Musk was a big part of that, but that was a decade ago.
They’ve really let the competition eat them up. And the CT is genuinely awful. /2

talk.author: did:plc:jfj6sqkawa2r72dhrx3rvjgr
talk.utter: The CyberTruck is a good representation of Musk 2025.  I'm an M.E.  Tesla is still way ahead of the competition in BMS, Power Electronics, vertical integration, and several manufacturing processes. Chinese EVs are the real competition.  G.M. and Ford are WAAAAY behind.

talk.author: did:plc:jfj6sqkawa2r72dhrx3rvjgr
talk.utter: The CyberTruck is a good representation of Musk 2025.  I'm an M.E.  Tesla is still way ahead of the competition in BMS, Power Electronics, vertical integration, and several manufacturing processes. Chinese EVs are the real competition.  G.M. and Ford are WAAAAY behind.

talk.author: did:plc:sd37wvyfzywf7tkqtslbfcfo
talk.utter: ME to ME  - until you show me the serial numbers on that truck, I’m not going to even look at it, forget investing into it, manufacturing processes or not.

talk.author: did:plc:jfj6sqkawa2r72dhrx3rvjgr
talk.utter:
Not sure I follow you. What do serial numbers have to do with this?
I also realize maybe I wasn't clear.  The Cybertruck is ridiculous as is Musk currently.  In 2010 I think Straubel and others kept things sane and we got the S.  In 2025 we get a meme truck.  The 2024 3 is more core Tesla.
